name: Eastern Wallaroo
image_alt: Eastern Wallaroo, photo: Antonín Vaidl, Prague Zoo
proportions: Total length 1.1–1.9 m, including tail 54–90 cm; females average 16 kg, males 35 kg (up to 50 kg record)
reproduction: Females are pregnant for 32 days and bear 1 young, carried in the pouch for 8–9 months
attractions: It is one of the few kangaroos where fur color indicates sex. It can survive months without drinking, relying on water from food. It finds shelter from midday heat under rock overhangs and in caves, which males defend against rivals, tolerating only females.
